meanings.definition: relating to the belief that all events are determined by causes external to the will
meanings.sent1: The deterministic nature of the experiment meant that the outcome was completely predictable.
meanings.sent2: Her deterministic approach to life made her feel like everything was predestined.
meanings.sent3: In a deterministic world, even the smallest actions could have significant consequences.
meanings.sent4: The deterministic view of history sees each event as a piece of a larger, predetermined puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a deterministic example to explain how every action has a reaction.
